rules: Do not trade Tavares during the current season.
Deploy him in a protected 2C/PP role for maximum playoff value.
Do not extend during the season.
At offseason: only recommend re-signing if AAV falls into 'cheap-tier' range (~2.5M–4M).
If the offer is not significantly discounted, default recommendation is to walk and reallocate cap.

general_rules: Prioritize RFAs and 24–28 age-range core pieces.
Avoid term traps on 30+ depth players unless extremely low AAV.
Maintain minimum cap buffer of 0.5M for in-season flexibility.

trade_policy.deadline_mode: Hybrid (Buy for core needs, hold futures unless value is strong)
rules: Avoid trading core prospects in the same window as losing Tavares.
Retained salary slots: max 2 (emergency use only).
No trades that reduce defensive stability below 6 NHL-caliber D.
Give Tier 1 prospects PP/PK time where chemistry allows.
Maintain NHL/AHL strategy alignment for smoother call-up transitions.
Increase TOI ~1–2 minutes per game for prospects who hit hot streaks.
Maintain system-matching between NHL and AHL unless major chemistry conflicts emerge.
Adjust forecheck and defensive pressure only when opponent-specific strategy demands it.
Call up players only if they fit the NHL system without breaking chemistry.
Do not call up waiver-requiring players unless absolutely necessary.
Prospects entering NHL trial must receive minimum 10–14 minutes TOI to evaluate properly.
Never reduce defensive depth below 6 proven NHL defensemen.
Avoid multi-year deals with 30+ depth players unless AAV under 1.0M.

notes: This OrgPolicy file defines the strategic DNA of the franchise for the 2024-12-27 baseline.
Dynasty GPT will reference this when evaluating trades, extensions, prospect usage, and system fit.
